705.01 POSTING HANDBILLS WITHOUT PROPERTY OWNER'S CONSENT.
         (a)    No person shall, in any manner, place or cause to be placed or
to appear on any structure or premises of another, within the City without the
consent of the person entitled to the possession of the structure or premises,
any handbill, notice, lettering, character or disfigurement.
         (b)    This section shall not apply to the posting of any handbill or
notice required, or otherwise specifically authorized, by law, to be posted.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.01)
         705.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
         No person, except as otherwise provided in this section and Sections
705.03 to
705.11, as principal, agent or employee, shall post, place, erect, fasten up,
distribute, maintain or display in the City any bill, sign, card, pamphlet,
circular or other matter containing any advertising, unless there is first
obtained from the Director of Finance a license to do so.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.05)
705.03 WHEN LICENSE NOT REQUIRED.
         No license, as required by Section
 705.02 shall be required:
         (a)    From those exempted in Section
705.11 hereof;
         (b)    Subject to the provisions of Section
705.10, for the passing or causing to be passed, of any printed or written
matter containing no advertising except that of the business or undertaking, or
article manufactured or produced or offered for sale by the party causing the
passing;
         (c)    From anyone for advertising, on his own premises, his own
business or occupation, or article manufactured or produced or offered for sale
by him;
         (d)    For any advertising done with the consent of the owner of the
premises, where the advertising is conducted on that part of the premises as is
inside of the wall confines of a building on the premises;
         (e)    For any advertising done with the consent of the owner of the
premises, of any enterprise regularly established and resident to the City.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.06)
705.04 RECORD.
   The Director of Finance shall keep an open record of licenses, as required
by Section
705.02, issued by him.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.07)
705.05 ISSUANCE UPON PAYMENT OF FEES.
         The Director of Finance is authorized to issue a license required by
Section
705.02 only on payment to him of the license fees set out in Section
705.06.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.08)
705.06 SCHEDULE OF FEES.
        The fees for licenses as required by Section
705.05 shall be as follows:
   (a)    For each separate billboard advertisement or other sign of a
permanent or semipermanent nature, a license fee of twenty-five dollars
($25.00) for each calendar year or portion of a calendar year during which the
advertisement or sign is displayed.
         (b)    For each separate set of signs, circulars, posters,
advertisements or cards not of a permanent or semipermanent nature and not
passed by hand, a license fee of ten dollars ($10.00) per week for each
calendar week or portion of a calendar week during which the same or any
portion thereof is displayed.
         (c)    For the distribution, by hand, of each separate set of bills,
pamphlets, circulars or advertising matter, a license fee of three dollars
($3.00) per day for each and every day during which the same are passed or
distributed within the City.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.09)
705.07 DEPOSIT OF FEES.
   All license fees required under Section
705.06 shall be deposited in the City Treasury.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.10)
705.08 PAYMENT OF FEES IN ADVANCE.
         All license fees required under Section
705.06 shall be payable in advance.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.11)
705.09 REMOVAL OF CERTAIN ADVERTISEMENTS.
   Upon the display of any advertisement, sign, circular, poster or card, as
referred to in Section
705.06(a) and (b), for which a license or renewal of license has not been
obtained, or for which the requisite license fee has not been paid, the
Director of Finance shall notify the owner or person in possession of the
premises on which the display occurs to remove the display within ten days from
the date of the notice, and unless it is removed within a ten-day period, the
owner or person in possession of the premises shall be deemed to be engaged in
displaying the same, and shall be subject to all the provisions of Sections
 705.02 to
705.11. However, the advertiser shall not thereby be relieved from liability
under the provisions of Section
705.02 to
705.11; and further, if the display is not so removed within the ten-day
period, in addition to all other remedies and penalties, the Mayor may cause
the removal of the display.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.12)
705.10 DISTRIBUTION OF HANDBILLS AND CIRCULARS; LICENSE NOT REQUIRED.
         Except as provided in Section
705.11, no person, as principal, agent or employee, where a license is not
required or obtained under the provisions of Section
705.02, shall pass, place or distribute any handbill, pamphlet or circular
containing any advertising matter or shall cause the same to be done, upon any
of the streets, alleys or public grounds or against the express prohibition of
the occupant, upon any private premises in the City.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.13)
705.11 POSTING OR DISTRIBUTING ADVERTISEMENTS; EXCEPTIONS.
         The provisions of Sections
705.02 to
705.10 shall not apply to any political advertising or the advertising of any
meeting, gathering, meal, entertainment or other enterprise to be conducted by
any church, school, lodge, regularly established club, patriotic or benevolent
society or enterprise to be conducted at the County Fair Grounds or to the
distribution of any newspaper, magazine, publication or program containing
advertising matter only as an incident thereto.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.14)
705.12 LICENSE REQUIRED FOR LOUDSPEAKERS.
         No person, as principal, agent or employee, shall operate or cause to
be operated for any advertising purpose, any so-called "loudspeaker" in the
City, unless there is first obtained from the Director of Finance a license to
do so.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.30)
705.13 APPLICATION.
         Any person desiring a license as required in Section
705.12 shall make application therefor to the Director of Finance stating the
uses, locations, times of day and the dates desired.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.31)
705.14 ISSUANCE; FEE.
         The license required by Section
705.12 shall be issued by the Director of Finance if he is of the opinion that
the use of the loudspeaker pursuant to the license will not cause undue
annoyance to the public, upon payment to the Director, for deposit in the City
Treasury, of a license fee of five dollars ($5.00) per day or part of a day
during which the loudspeaker shall be so licensed.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.32)
705.15 LIMITATIONS UPON USE.
         A license issued as provided in Section
705.12 shall be limited to the uses, locations, time of day and dates as the
Director of Finance shall specify in the license.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.33)
705.16 EXCEPTIONS TO LOUDSPEAKER REGULATIONS.
         Nothing contained in Sections
705.12 to
705.15 shall apply to the use of a loudspeaker at the County Fair Grounds,
athletic contests, political or other lawful gatherings, inside of any school
building, church, public hall or regularly established theater or in
advertising any meeting or enterprise to be conducted at the County Fair
Grounds or by any church, school, lodge or regularly established club,
patriotic, or benevolent society.
(1984 Code Sec. 110.34)
705.99 PENALTY.
         Whoever violates any provision of this chapter, for which another
penalty is not specifically provided, is guilty of a minor misdemeanor for each
offense. Each day during which any such violation occurs shall constitute a
separate offense.
CHAPTER 711
Billiard Rooms
711.01     Definitions.
711.02     When operation prohibited.
711.03     Operation disturbing peace and quiet of neighborhood.
711.04     Permitting entrance of minors.
711.05     Unobstructed view of premises.
711.06     Rules and regulations.
711.07     License required.
711.08     Filing of application.
711.09     Contents of application.
711.10     Affidavit as to convictions of applicant.
711.11     Denial of application.
711.12     Issuance generally; what authorized.
711.13     Form.
711.14     Issuance for establishment in certain locations.
711.15     Conditions of issuance.
711.16     Separate licensing of individual establishments.
711.17     Fees; amount; disposition.
711.18     Refund of license fee.
711.19     Term; assignment or transfer.
711.21     Revocation generally.
711.22     Appeal from denial or revocation.
711.99     Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.51, 715.61
 
 
711.01 DEFINITIONS.
         For the purposes of this chapter, the following words and phrases
shall have the following meanings ascribed to them respectively.
         (a)    "Billiard room" means any public place in which one or more
billiard tables are maintained for use.
         (b)    "Billiard table" includes pool table.
        (c)    "Public place" means any building, hall, store, room or place,
or part of any thereof, which is open to or frequented by the public and which
is operated for gain or profit.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.45)
711.02 WHEN OPERATION PROHIBITED.
         No person being the owner, operator, proprietor, keeper, manager or
person in charge or control of a billiard room shall open, keep open or operate
the same, or knowingly shall permit the same to be opened, kept open or
operated, between the hours of 12:00 a.m. and 6:00 a.m. on any weekday or
during any hours on Sunday when the operation thereof is prohibited by State
law.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.46)
711.03 OPERATION DISTURBING PEACE AND QUIET OF NEIGHBORHOOD.
         No person being the owner, operator, proprietor, keeper, manager or
person in charge or control of a billiard room shall operate or conduct a
billiard room in a manner as to disturb the peace and quiet of the neighborhood
or vicinity in which the same is located.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.47)
711.04 PERMITTING ENTRANCE OF MINORS.
         No person being the owner, operator, proprietor, keeper, manager or
person in charge or control of a billiard room shall knowingly permit any minor
under the age of eighteen years to enter or remain in a billiard room.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.49)
711.05 UNOBSTRUCTED VIEW OF PREMISES.
         All billiard rooms shall be so conducted that there is at all times an
unobstructed view from the street of all portions of the premises, except
toilet rooms, to which the public or any person other than the proprietor or
his employees are permitted or allowed to have access.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.50)
711.06 RULES AND REGULATIONS.
         The Mayor may establish, adopt and enforce, or cause to be enforced,
the rules and regulations governing the establishment, conduct, maintenance and
operation of billiard rooms as he may deem reasonable and necessary and as are
not inconsistent with the provisions of Sections
711.01 to
 711.05. No person shall fail, neglect or refuse to comply with the rules and
regulations.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.51)
 
711.07 LICENSE REQUIRED.
         No person shall establish, maintain or operate a billiard room in the
City unless the person first obtains a license therefor in the manner provided
in this chapter.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.55)
711.08 FILING OF APPLICATION.
         An application for a license required by Section
711.07 shall be filed or made only by the person seeking the proposed license
and shall be addressed to and filed with the Director of Finance, at the office
of the Director on forms prescribed by him.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.56)
711.09 CONTENTS OF APPLICATION.
         Each application for a license as required by Section
711.07 shall set forth the full name and address of the applicant; whether the
applicant is an individual, firm, corporation, association or organization; the
citizenship of the applicant; the location of each billiard room proposed to be
licensed; the number of billiard tables contained or maintained, or proposed to
be contained or maintained in the billiard room; and any other information as
may be required by the Director of Finance.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.57)
711.10 AFFIDAVIT AS TO CONVICTIONS OF APPLICANT.
         Any person filing an application, as provided in Section
711.08, shall furnish an affidavit setting forth information pertaining to
proper convictions, if any, of the applicant of crimes involving moral
turpitude.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.58)
711.11 DENIAL OF APPLICATION.
         The Director of Finance may deny, for any just or reasonable cause,
any application for a license, as required in Section
711.07.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.59)
711.12 ISSUANCE GENERALLY; WHAT AUTHORIZED.
         Upon compliance by the applicant as required in Section
711.07 with the provisions and requirements of Sections
711.07 to
711.22 and the determination by the Director of Finance that the applicant is
of good moral character and that the operation of a billiard room at the
location specified in the application will not jeopardize the public peace,
safety, comfort and welfare and upon the payment of the license fee prescribed
in Section
711.17, the Director may issue to the applicant a license which permits the
establishment, maintenance and operation of a billiard room at the location
specified in the application for the license.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.60)
711.13 FORM.
         Any license issued under Section
711.07 to
711.22 shall be issued in such form as shall be specified by the Director of
Finance.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.61)
711.14 ISSUANCE FOR ESTABLISHMENT IN CERTAIN LOCATIONS.
         No license required by Sections
711.07 to
711.22 shall be issued for the establishment, maintenance or operation of a
billiard room within 150 feet of the property of any church, school or
hospital. (1984 Code Sec. 114.62)
711.15 CONDITIONS OF ISSUANCE.
         Any license issued under Sections
711.07  to 
711.22  shall be issued subject to the conditions and provisions of this
chapter and other ordinances of the City and laws of the State relating to and
subject to any rules and regulations promulgated or adopted pursuant to Section
711.06.  (1984 Code Sec. 114.63)
 
711.16 SEPARATE LICENSING OF INDIVIDUAL ESTABLISHMENTS.
         Individual billiard rooms licensed under Sections
711.07 to
711.22 shall be separately licensed. (1984 Code Sec. 114.64)
711.17 FEES; AMOUNT; DISPOSITION.
         No license required by Section
711.07 shall be issued, as provided in Sections
711.05 to
711.22, unless the person applying therefor first pays to the City an annual
license fee equal to the amount of twenty dollars ($20.00) for the first
billiard table and the amount of ten dollars ($10.00) for each additional
billiard table located, exhibited or maintained for use in the billiard room in
question. Fees so paid shall be deposited to the General Fund of the City.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.65)
711.18 REFUND OF LICENSE FEE.
         No surrender or revocation of or failure to utilize any license issued
under Sections
711.07 to
711.22 shall obligate the City to refund any part of any license fee, as
referred to in Section
711.17, previously paid.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.66)
711.19 TERM; ASSIGNMENT OR TRANSFER.
         Every license issued under Sections
711.07 to
711.22 shall expire on December 31 of the year in which the same is issued. No
license shall be transferable or assignable.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.67)
711.20 DISPLAY.
         Every license issued under Sections
711.07 to
711.22 shall at all times be kept posted in a conspicuous place in the billiard
room covered thereby.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.68)
711.21 REVOCATION GENERALLY.
         The license issued under Sections
711.07 to
711.22 of a person violating any of the terms or provisions of this chapter or
any other provision of the Codified Ordinances or other ordinance of the City
or State law or any rule or regulation promulgated by the Mayor as authorized
by Section
711.06, having any relationship to billiard rooms, may be revoked by the
Director by written notice of the revocation delivered or mailed to the address
of the licensee in question specified in the application for the license.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.69)
711.22 APPEAL FROM DENIAL OR REVOCATION.
         A licensee whose license issued under Sections
711.07 to
711.22 has been revoked or an applicant for a license under Sections
711.07 to
711.22 to whom a license has been denied may appeal in writing to Council,
within ten days after the date of the revocation or denial. The appeal shall be
filed with the Clerk of Council. Council shall hear the appeal within twenty
days after the date of the filing and shall affirm, disaffirm or modify the
denial or revocation. The decision of Council shall be final.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.70)
711.99 PENALTY.
         Whoever violates any provisions of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for each offense.
CHAPTER 717
Bowling Alleys
717.01     Definition.
717.02     When operation prohibited.
717.03     Operation disturbing peace and quiet of neighborhood.
717.04    Rules and regulations.

717.06     Filing of application.
717.07     Contents of application.
717.08     Affidavit as to convictions of applicant.
717.09     Denial of application.
717.10     Issuance generally; what authorized.
717.11     Form.
717.12     Issuances for establishment in certain locations.
717.13     Conditions of issuance.
717.14     Separate licensing of individual establishments.
717.15    Fees; amount; disposition.
717.16     Refund.
717.17     Term; assignment or transfer.
717.18     Display.
717.19     Revocation generally.
717.20     Appeal from denial or revocation.
717.99     Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Liquor control - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
529
 
 
717.01 DEFINITION.
         For the purposes of Sections
717.02 to
717.04, the following words and phrases shall have the following meanings
ascribed to them respectively:
         "Bowling alley" means any indoor building, room, space or area, which
is open to or frequented by the public and operated for gain, and in which is
located for use one or more smooth surface ways, usually forty-two inches by
sixty feet in dimensions each, upon which balls are rolled toward standing
pins. (1984 Code Sec. 114.20)
717.02 WHEN OPERATION PROHIBITED.
         No owner, operator, proprietor, manager or person in charge or control
of a bowling alley shall operate the bowling alley, or knowingly cause or
permit the bowling alley to be operated or used between the hours of 1:00 a.m.
and 8:00 a.m. on any weekday or during the hours on Sunday when the operation
of a bowling alley is prohibited by State law.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.21)
717.03 OPERATION DISTURBING PEACE AND QUIET OF NEIGHBORHOOD.
         No owner, operator, proprietor, manager or person in charge or control
of a bowling alley shall operate or conduct the bowling alley in a manner as to
disturb the peace and quiet of the neighborhood or vicinity in which the
bowling alley is located.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.22)
717.04 RULES AND REGULATIONS.
         The Mayor may establish, adopt and enforce, or cause to be enforced,
the rules and regulations governing the establishment, conduct, maintenance and
operation of bowling alleys as he may deem reasonable and necessary and as are
not inconsistent with the provisions of Sections
717.02 and
717.03. No person shall fail, neglect or refuse to comply with the rules and
regulations.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.23)
717.05 LICENSE REQUIRED.
         No person shall establish, maintain or operate a bowling alley in the
City unless the person first obtains a license therefor in the manner provided
in this section and Sections
717.06 to
717.20.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.25)
717.06 FILING OF APPLICATION.
         An application for a license as required by Section
717.05 shall be filed or made only by the proposed licensee and shall be
addressed to and filed with the Director of Finance at the office of the
Director on forms prescribed by the Director.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.26)
717.07 CONTENTS OF APPLICATION.
      Each application for a license as required by Section
717.05 shall set forth the full name and address of the applicant; whether the
applicant is an individual, firm, corporation, association or other
organization; the location of the bowling alley proposed to be licensed; the
number of individual alleys contained or maintained, or proposed to be
contained or maintained in the bowling alley; and any additional information as
may be required by the Director of Finance.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.27)
717.08 AFFIDAVIT AS TO CONVICTIONS OF APPLICANT.
         Any person filing an application, as provided in Section
717.06, shall furnish an affidavit setting forth information pertaining to
prior convictions, if any, of crimes involving moral turpitude.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.28)
717.09 DENIAL OF APPLICATION.
         The Director of Finance may deny, for judicious and reasonable cause,
any application for a license as required in Section
717.05.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.29)
717.10 ISSUANCE GENERALLY; WHAT AUTHORIZED.
         Upon compliance by the applicant for a license, as required in Section
717.05, with the provisions and requirements of Sections
717.05 to
717.20 and upon the determination by the Director of Finance that the applicant
is of good moral character and that the operation of a bowling alley at the
location specified in the application will not jeopardize the public peace,
safety, comfort and welfare, and upon the payment of the license fee prescribed
in Section
717.15, the Director may issue to the applicant a license which permits the
establishment, maintenance and
operation of a bowling alley at the location specified in the application.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.30)
717.11 FORM.
         Any license issued under Sections
717.05 to
717.20 shall be in such a form as specified by the Director of Finance.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.31)
717.12 ISSUANCES FOR ESTABLISHMENT IN CERTAIN LOCATIONS.
         No license required by Sections
717.05 to
717.20 shall be issued for the establishment, maintenance or operation of a
bowling alley within 150 feet of the property of any church, school or
hospital.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.32)
717.13 CONDITIONS OF ISSUANCE.
         Any license issued under Sections
717.05 to
717.20 shall be issued subject to the conditions and provisions of this
chapter, any other ordinance of the City relating to bowling alleys and subject
to any rules and regulations promulgated or adopted pursuant to Section
717.04.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.33)
717.14 SEPARATE LICENSING OF INDIVIDUAL ESTABLISHMENTS.
         Individual bowling alley establishments licensed under Sections
717.05 to
717.20 shall be separately licensed.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.34)
717.15 FEES; AMOUNT; DISPOSITION.
         No license required by Section
717.05 shall be issued, as provided in Sections
717.05 to
717.20, unless the person applying therefor first pays to the City an annual
license fee equal to the amount of twenty dollars ($20.00) for the first alley
and the amount of ten dollars ($10.00) for each additional alley located,
exhibited or maintained for use in the bowling alley in question. Fees so paid
shall be deposited to the General Fund of the City.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.35)
717.16 REFUND.
         No surrender or revocation of or failure to utilize any license issued
under Sections
717.05 to
717.20 shall obligate the City to refund any part of any license fee, as
referred to in Section
717.15, previously paid.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.36)
717.17 TERM; ASSIGNMENT OR TRANSFER.
         Every license issued under Sections
717.05 to
717.20 shall expire on December 31 of the year in which it is issued. No
license shall be assignable or transferable.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.37)
717.18 DISPLAY.
         Every license issued under Sections
717.05 to
717.20 shall at all times be kept posted in a conspicuous place or in the
immediate vicinity of any bowling alley covered thereby.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.38)
717.19 REVOCATION GENERALLY.
         The license issued under Sections
717.05 to
717.20 of a person violating any of the terms or provisions of Sections
717.02 to
717.20 or any other provision of the Codified Ordinances or other ordinance of
the City or State law or any rule or regulation promulgated by the Mayor, as
authorized by Section
717.04, having relationship to bowling alleys, may be revoked by the Director.
Written notice of the revocation shall be delivered or mailed to the address of
the licensee in question as specified in the application for the license.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.39)
717.20 APPEAL FROM DENIAL OR REVOCATION.
         A licensee whose license issued under Sections
717.05 to
717.20 has been revoked or an applicant for a license under Sections
717.05 to
717.20 to whom a license has been denied may appeal in writing to Council
within ten days after the date of the revocation or denial. The appeal shall be
filed with the Clerk of Council. Council shall hear the appeal within twenty
days after the date of the filing of the appeal and shall affirm, disaffirm or
modify the revocation or denial. The decision of Council shall be final.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.40)
717.99 PENALTY.
        Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for each offense.
CHAPTER 721
Circuses and Carnivals
721.01     License required.
721.02     Date of exhibition to be specified.
721.03     Fees.
721.04     Exception as to moving picture shows.
721.99     Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.48, 715.63, 3765.02
Contests or games at county fairs - see Ohio R.C. 1711.09, 1711.11
State licensing of portable amusement devices - see Ohio R.C. 1711.11(H)
County license for public shows - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 3765
Amusement devices design and construction - see OAC Ch. 4101:2-29-32
 
 
721.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall exhibit in the City any theatrical performance of any kind
or description, circus, menagerie, puppet show, tumbling, rope or wire dancing
or balancing, sleight of hand or minstrel show, carnival or any natural or
artificial curiosity, or deception or representation of any kind whatsoever,
either real or fictitious, for which compensation is demanded or received,
unless the person first obtains from the Director of Finance a license to hold
the exhibition or show. (1984 Code Sec. 114.01)
721.02 DATE OF EXHIBITION TO BE SPECIFIED.
         Each license, as referred to in Section
721.01 shall specify the particular date and the time of day when exhibitions
may be held pursuant thereto.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.02)
721.03 FEES.
         For circuses, menageries, combined circuses and menageries, and
carnivals, a license fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per day shall be paid
and for all other species of entertainments, exhibitions or performances a
license fee of five dollars ($5.00) per day shall be paid. However, no license
fee shall be charged for any home talent show, church, school, lodge or
American Legion show, exhibition or entertainment, or any performance on the
fair grounds during the County Fair or any legal holiday which may be given
with the consent of the County Fair Board. At least three days' written notice
shall be given to the Director of Finance of the intention to hold any such
exhibition, show or entertainment herein exempted from license fees. The notice
is to give full detail as to the character of the exhibition, and the dates and
time when the same is proposed to be given.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.03)
721.04 EXCEPTION AS TO MOVING PICTURE SHOWS.
         Nothing in Sections
721.01 to
721.03 shall apply to or affect any regularly established moving picture show
in any regularly established theater.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.04)
721.99 PENALTY.
         Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for each offense.
CHAPTER 723
Coin-Operated Devices

MECHANICAL MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS

JUKE BOX LICENSES
723.25    Required.
723.26     Fee.
723.99     Penalty.
                    
CROSS REFERENCES
Disturbing the peace - see GEN. OFF.
509.03
 
AMUSEMENT DEVICES
 
723.01 DEFINITIONS.
        For the purposes of this chapter, the following words and phrases shall
have the following meanings ascribed to them respectively.
         (a)    "Exhibitor" means any person who is the owner, proprietor,
manager or other person in charge or in control of a place as defined in this
section.
         (b)    "Juke box" means any machine, apparatus, instrument or device
which is, in whole or in part, mechanically or electrically operated upon the
insertion of a coin only, in a slot, crevice or opening therein, and which
emits recorded music.
         (c)    "Mechanical amusement device" means any machine, apparatus,
instrument or device, except a juke box, as defined in this section, but
including those that are commonly designated pinball" or "skeeball" devices,
which are, in whole or in part, mechanically or electrically operated upon the
insertion of coin only in a slot, crevice or opening therein, which is operated
solely for amusement in the form of play which determines the skill of the
player, which emits or returns no money, coin, slug, token, merchandise,
reward, free play or other thing of value, and which is not so constructed or
equipped as to constitute or become adaptable to use as a gambling device.
         (d)    "Place" means any hall, store, room, shop, restaurant, hotel,
cafe, theater, club, institution, headquarters, meeting place or other premises
or place within the City, except an actual and bona fide residence.
            (1984 Code Sec. 115.01)
723.02 USE FOR GAMBLING, ETC.
         No person, whether an exhibitor or a nonexhibitor of a mechanical
amusement device, knowingly shall use, play or operate the mechanical amusement
device, or cause or permit the use, play or operation of the mechanical
amusement device, for gambling purposes, or for wagering or chance, or as a
gambling device or for any purpose other than the entertainment and test of
skill of the player or operator thereof.(1984 Code Sec. 115.02)
723.03 CONVERSION TO GAMBLING DEVICE.
         No person, whether an exhibitor or nonexhibitor of a mechanical
amusement device, shall knowingly convert or adapt the mechanical amusement
device or any part or equipment thereof from a lawful amusement instrument to a
device which constitutes or could be used as a gambling device.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.03)
723.04 HOURS WHEN USE PROHIBITED.
         No person, whether an exhibitor or nonexhibitor of a mechanical
instrument device, shall knowingly use, play or operate, or cause or permit to
be used, played or operated any mechanical amusement device in or upon any
place, as defined in Section
723.01, between the hours of 2:00 a.m. and 8:00 a.m. on any day.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.05)
723.05 EXHIBITION WHEN NOT IN WORKING ORDER.
         No person, whether an exhibitor or nonexhibitor of a mechanical
amusement device, shall knowingly exhibit or maintain a mechanical amusement
device for play, operation or use when the mechanical amusement device is not
in working order and condition as will furnish the amusement or entertainment
for which it was designed or is represented, unless there is attached thereto a
conspicuous and legible sign or warning containing the phrase "out of order" or
words of similar import. (1984 Code Sec. 115.06)
723.06 RULES AND REGULATIONS GOVERNING EXHIBITION, MAINTENANCE.
         The Mayor may establish, adopt and enforce, or cause to be enforced
such rules and regulations, not in conflict with this chapter, governing the
exhibition, maintenance, operation and use of mechanical amusement devices as
he may deem reasonable and necessary to carry out the provisions of Sections
723.01  to
723.06 . The rules and regulations when adopted shall have the same force and
effect as if contained, made part of, or specifically set forth in this
chapter.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.07)
LICENSE FOR MAINTENANCE, EXHIBITION OR OPERATION
723.07 REQUIRED.
         No person shall maintain, exhibit or operate, or permit or cause to be
maintained, exhibited or operated, in or upon any place under his control, any
mechanical amusement device without first having obtained a license therefor in
the manner provided in Section
723.09.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.10)
723.08 DEVICES TO BE SEPARATELY LICENSED.
         Each individual mechanical amusement device shall be separately
licensed and a license fee, as specified in Section
723.20, shall be paid for each mechanical amusement device.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.11)
723.09 APPLICATIONS GENERALLY.
         An application for a license as required in Section
723.07 shall be made only by a proposed licensee, shall be made separately with
respect to each mechanical amusement device, shall be addressed to and filed
with the Director of Finance, at the office of the Director and shall be made
on forms prescribed by him. Each application shall set forth the full name and
address of the applicant; whether the applicant is an individual, firm,
corporation or other organization; the make, type, model and serial number or
other identifying symbol of the mechanical amusement device sought to be
licensed; the place at which the mechanical amusement device is proposed to be
maintained, exhibited or operated; and any other information as may be
reasonably required by the Director. (1984 Code Sec. 115.12)
723.10 RULES AND REGULATIONS FOR APPLICATIONS.
         The Mayor may adopt and enforce rules and regulations pertaining to
applications for and processing and issuance of licenses under Sections
723.07 to
723.22. The rules and regulations may include the requirement from an applicant
of an affidavit setting forth information relating to the convictions, if any,
of the applicant for any crime or misdemeanor involving moral turpitude. (1984
Code Sec. 115.13)
723.11 ISSUANCE; PERMITTED ACTIVITIES.
         Upon compliance with the provisions and requirements of Sections
723.07 to
723.22 and upon the determination by the Director of Finance that the applicant
filing an application, as provided in Section
723.09, is of good moral character and that the operation of the mechanical
amusement device with reference to which the application is filed at the place
specified in the application will not be detrimental to the public peace,
safety and welfare, and the payment of the requisite license fee, the Director
shall be authorized to issue a license to the applicant, which license shall
permit the maintenance, exhibition and operation, at the place specified in the
application, of one or more mechanical amusement devices described in the
application.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.14)
723.12 AUTHORITY OF FINANCE DIRECTOR TO DENY.
         The Director of Finance may, for any reasonable cause, refuse to issue
a license for which an application has been made as provided in Section
723.09.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.15)
723.13 EVIDENCE OF LICENSING.
         A separate license for each mechanical amusement device shall be
evidenced by a separate form. This form shall be as specified by the Director
of Finance.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.16)
723.14 CONDITIONS UNDER WHICH ISSUED.
         Any license issued as provided in Section
723.09 shall be issued subject to the conditions, provisions, requirements and
prohibitions of Sections
723.07 to
723.22 and any other ordinances of the City relating to mechanical amusement
devices and subject to any rules and regulations promulgated pursuant to the
provisions of Section
723.06.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.17)
723.15 TERM.
         Unless earlier revoked in the manner provided in Sections
723.07 to
723.22, every license issued under the provisions of Section
723.07 to
723.22 shall expire on December 31 of the year in which the license is issued.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.18)
723.16 LICENSEES TO BE OF GOOD MORAL CHARACTER.
         No license, as required in Section
723.07, shall be issued to any person who is not known to the Director of
Finance to be of good moral character.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.19)
723.17 DEVICES FOR WHICH LICENSE IS NOT ISSUED.
         No license, as required in Section
723.07, shall be issued for any mechanical amusement device which is a gambling
device per se or which is adaptable to or may be readily converted into a
gambling device.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.20)
723.18 TRANSFER OF LICENSE FROM ONE DEVICE TO ANOTHER OR FROM LICENSEE;
TRANSFER OF LOCATION.
         Upon the payment of a transfer fee, as required in Section
723.20, the Director of Finance may permit the transfer of a license issued
under Sections
723.07 to
723.22 from one mechanical amusement device to another such device maintained,
exhibited or operated by the same licensee and permit the transfer of a
licensed mechanical amusement device from one place to another place owned,
operated or controlled by the licensee of the instrument. No license shall be
transferred from one licensee to another licensee or from a licensee to a
person not a licensee without the consent and approval of the Director and then
only upon payment of the requisite transfer fee. No transfer of a license
issued pursuant to Sections
723.07 to
723.22 shall be made other than in the manner provided for in this section.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.21)
723.19 POSTING.
        Every license issued pursuant to Sections
723.07 to
723.22 shall at all times be kept posted in a conspicuous place or in the
immediate vicinity of the mechanical amusement device covered thereby. (1984
Code Sec. 115.22)
723.20 FEES.
   (a)    No license requirement by Sections
723.07 to
723.22 shall be issued unless the person applying therefor shall first pay to
the City, to be credited to the General Fund thereof, an annual license fee in
an amount specified by the Board of Control with approval, by motion of Council
for each mechanical amusement or juke box device to be so licensed. Further, no
person, partnership or corporation shall operate more than three mechanical
amusement devices at a single structure or property unless they first obtain a
license to do so from the Director of Finance and pay an additional fee
specified by the Board of Control with approval, by motion, of Council. On all
licenses required by Sections
723.07 to
723.22, the license fee payable shall be as follows:
(1)    If the application for the license is made prior to April 1, the normal
fee.
(2)    If the application is made on or after April 1, and prior to July 1,
three-fourths of the normal fee.
(3)    If the application is made on or after July 1, and prior to October 1,
one-half of the normal fee.
(4)    If the application is made on or after October 1, and prior to January
1, one-fourth of the normal fee.
         (b)    No transfer of a license issued pursuant to Sections
723.07 to
723.22 shall be made without the payment to the City of a transfer fee in the
amount of two dollars ($2.00), which fee shall likewise be credited to the
General Fund.
         (c)    The surrender or revocation of, or failure to utilize, any
license issued under the provisions of Sections
723.07 to
723.22 shall not obligate the City to refund any part of any license fee or
transfer fee previously paid.
 
         (d)    Nothing contained in this chapter requiring the payment of a
license or transfer fee shall be construed as the imposition or exaction of a
tax of any nature, it being determined that the license and transfer fees
provided for in this section are required solely for the purpose of
administering Sections
723.07 to
723.22 and for enforcing the regulatory measures contained in Sections
723.07 to
723.22. (1984 Code Sec. 115.23)
723.21 REVOCATION GENERALLY.
        The license of a person violating any of the terms or provisions of
this chapter, or any rule or regulation as authorized by Section
723.06 or of any person convicted of any crime or misdemeanor involving moral
turpitude may be revoked by the Director by written notice of such revocation
delivered or mailed to the licensee at the address of the violating licensee as
specified in his application for a license.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.24)
723.22 APPEAL OF REVOCATION OR DENIAL.
         A licensee whose license issued under Sections
723.07 to
723.22 has been revoked or an applicant for a license under this chapter to
whom a license has been denied, may appeal in writing to Council within ten
days after the date of the revocation or denial. The appeal shall be filed with
the Clerk of Council. Council shall hear the appeal within twenty days after
the date of the filing and may, in its discretion, consider the same either in
whole or in part upon the evidence considered by the Director of Finance or de
novo. Council shall affirm, disaffirm or modify the order or revocation and its
decision shall be administratively final.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.25)
MECHANICAL MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS
723.23 OPERATION DURING CERTAIN HOURS.
         No person shall disturb the good order and quiet of the City by
operating or causing to be operated between the hours from 12:00 a.m. to 8:00
a.m. in any public place in the City, including restaurants, sandwich shops,
hotels and any other public place, any mechanical musical instrument,
nickelodeon, music box, victrola, radio or other mechanical musical instrument,
electric or otherwise, whether the conduct directly disturbs the tranquility of
the City at large or any individual therein or is detrimental to the public
peace.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.40)
723.24 PERMITTING OPERATION DURING CERTAIN HOURS.
         No person shall disturb the good order and quiet in the City by
permitting or suffering the operation between the hours from 12:00 a.m. to 8:00
a.m., in any public place in the City, including restaurants, sandwich shops,
hotels and any other public place, of any mechanical instrument, nickelodeon,
music box, victrola, radio or any other mechanical musical instrument, electric
or otherwise, whether the conduct directly disturbs the tranquility of the City
at large or any individual therein or is detrimental to the public peace.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.41)
JUKE BOX LICENSES
723.25 REQUIRED.
         No person shall maintain, exhibit or operate, or permit or cause to be
maintained, exhibited or operated, in or upon any place under his control, any
juke box without first obtaining a license therefor in the same manner provided
for obtaining licenses for mechanical amusement devices pursuant to Sections
723.07 to
723.22. Each individual juke box shall be separately licensed. (1984 Code Sec.
115.45)
723.26 FEE.
         An annual license fee in the amount established by the Board of
Control with approval, by motion, of Council shall be charged for each juke box
licensed as provided in Section
723.25. The license fee shall be paid in accordance with, and subject to the
provisions of Section
723.20.
(1984 Code Sec. 115.46)
723.99 PENALTY.
         Whoever violates any provision of this chapter, where another penalty
is not provided, is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree. Each day that
the violation continues shall be considered a separate offense.
CHAPTER 727
Dance Halls and Skating Rinks
727.01     Allowing intoxicating liquor on premises.
727.02     Allowing intoxicated persons on premises.
727.03     Permit required.
727.04     Separate permit for each dance.
727.05     Permit fees.
727.06     Revocation of permit.
727.07     Police on premises.
727.08     Exceptions.
727.99     Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Dancing academies or public ballrooms - See Ohio R.C. 715.61
Intoxicating liquor in dance hall - see Ohio R.C. 4399.14
 
 
727.01 ALLOWING INTOXICATING LIQUOR ON PREMISES.
         No proprietor of any public dance hall or roller skating rink, or any
person who conducts, manages or is in charge of any public dance hall or roller
skating rink shall permit or allow the use of any beer or intoxicating liquor
in the dance hall or roller skating rink, or on the premises on which the dance
hall or roller skating rink is located.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.10)
727.02 ALLOWING INTOXICATED PERSONS ON PREMISES.
         No proprietor of any public dance hall or roller skating rink or any
person who conducts, manages or is in charge of any public dance hall or roller
skating rink shall permit or allow the presence of any intoxicated person in
the dance hall or roller skating rink or on the premises.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.11)
727.03 PERMIT REQUIRED.
         No person shall give, or knowingly permit any person acting for him to
give, any public dance, ball, roller skating or like entertainment, within the
City without having first obtained a permit therefor from the Director of
Finance.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.12)
727.04 SEPARATE PERMIT FOR EACH DANCE.
         The payment of the license fee provided for in Section
727.05 shall not relieve the applicant from the necessity of securing a
separate permit for each separate dance, ball or like entertainment, except
under the provisions of Section
727.05(b).
(1984 Code Sec. 114.13)
727.05 PERMIT FEES.
         (a)    A fee of ten dollars ($10.00) shall be charged by the Director
of Finance for each and every permit issued pursuant to Section
727.03, excepting and provided, that in cases where no license to sell beer or
intoxicating liquors, under Ohio R.C. 4301.01 to 4301.991, has been issued to
and is in effect as to the applicant for the permit or the owner or occupant of
the premises on which the dance, ball, roller skating or like entertainment is
to be held, and where no beer or intoxicating liquor is consumed or possessed
by anyone on the premises while the dance, ball, roller skating or like
entertainment is being held, the applicant for the permit may, at his election,
pay a fee of twenty dollars ($20.00) which shall cover all fees for all the
permits obtained by him applying to the same premises during the remainder of
the calendar month in which the twenty dollar ($20.00) fee is paid. In the
event that the twenty dollar ($20.00) fee has be paid, the payment shall not
entitle the applicant to the refund thereof or of any part thereof in the event
that the Director refuses to issue permits to the applicant for the balance of
the calendar month, or shall revoke any permits given. The fees shall be paid
by the Director into the City Treasury in the same manner as are license fees.
        (b)    In the event a dance hall, roller skating rink or like
entertainment, conducted as a permanent business, has an established location
and the premises are used principally as a dance hall, roller skating rink or
like entertainment and only infrequently used for other purposes, the Director
may issue a permit for the calendar year or that part of the calendar year
remaining when the permit is issued. A fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00)
shall be charged for all or any part of a calendar year with no provision for
proration or refund if not used for the entire calendar year. All such permits
shall expire on December 31 of each year.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.14)
727.06 REVOCATION OF PERMIT.
         Any permit issued pursuant to Section
727.03 may at any time be revoked by the Director of Finance.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.15)
727.07 POLICE ON PREMISES.
         The Chief of Police may detail a police officer to the premises where
a dance, ball, roller skating or like entertainment is given pursuant to a
permit as required in Section
727.03, or the Director of Finance may, as a condition to the granting of the
permit, require that the applicant for the permit, at the cost and expense of
the applicant, maintain on duty on the premises throughout the duration of the
dance, ball, roller skating or like entertainment, a special police officer
acceptable to the Director.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.16)
727.08 EXCEPTIONS.
         The provisions of Sections
727.03 to
727.08 shall not apply to the giving of private dances limited, in attendance,
to the bona fide members of the club, association or organization giving the
dance or to those present under and pursuant to a bona fide personal
invitation.
(1984 Code Sec. 114.17)
727.99 PENALTY.
         (a)    Any person violating any provision of this chapter for which
another penalty has not been provided is guilty of a minor misdemeanor for each
offense. Each day during which such violation continues shall constitute a
separate offense.
         (b)    In case of violation of any provision of this chapter by any
association or corporation, the members, officers or directors having control
of and being in charge of any dance, dance hall or roller skating rink shall be
personally liable for the penalties herein provided.
CHAPTER 733
Going Out of Business Sales
733.01     License required.
733.02     Application for license.
733.03     Limitation of inventory.
733.04     Term and renewal of license; limitation on issuance.
733.05     License fee.
733.06     Investigations.
733.07     Exceptions.
733.99    Penalty.
 
 
733.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.
         No person in the business of the retail sale of goods, wares or
merchandise shall sell, offer for sale or announce or advertise for sale, the
goods, wares or merchandise when the sale is described or referred to, either
directly or indirectly, in form or in substance, as a going out of business,
removal, loss, termination, loss or expiration of lease, closing out,
liquidation, creditors', damaged goods, forced sale or distressed stock sale,
or by any other term which reasonably leads the public to believe that the
owner or offerer of the goods, wares or merchandise, either by choice or
necessity, will no longer engage in business, without first obtaining a license
as provided in this chapter.
(1984 Sec. 116.20)
733.02 APPLICATION FOR LICENSE.
         Each applicant for a license, as required by Section
733.01, shall make an application to the Director of Finance not later than
thirty days prior to the advertising or offering for sale of any goods, wares
or merchandise. The applicant shall make a full disclosure, under oath, of the
following information:
         (a)    The true name of the owner of the goods, wares or merchandise
to be offered for sale.
         (b)    The name of the operator of the sale, if the operator is a
person other than the true owner.
         (c)    A full and complete inventory of the quantity, kind and
character of the articles to be offered for sale, which inventory shall be
prepared in the following manner:
                 (1)    An itemized listing of all the articles and quantities
thereof remaining unsold which have been in stock on the premises where the
sale is to be conducted for a period of fifteen days or longer prior to the
application for the license.
                 (2)    An itemized listing of all articles and the quantities
thereof received in stock on the premises within the fifteen days immediately
preceding the application for the license.
                 (3)    An itemized listing of all articles and the quantities
which have been ordered or which will be ordered and placed in stock during the
pendency of the sale which includes orders which are bona fide without
cancellation privileges and shall not comprise goods, wares or merchandise
purchased on consignment.
(1984 Code Sec. 116.21)
733.03 LIMITATION ON INVENTORY.
         No additions whatsoever shall be made to the stock of goods, wares or
merchandise set forth in the inventory attached to the application for the
license, as referred to in Section
733.02 and nothing shall be offered for sale or sold at a sale held pursuant to
a license, as required in Section
733.01, which is in addition to the stock of goods, wares or merchandise
described in the inventory. The inventory offered for sale shall not exceed
fifty percent (50%) of the average inventory carried by the applicant for a
license, as required in Section
733.01, over the preceding five years or, if the applicant has been in business
for a lesser period of time, then the inventory offered for sale shall not
exceed fifty percent (50%) of the average inventory carried for the period of
time the applicant has been in business. Any abnormal purchases during the year
prior to the application for a license shall be cause for refusal to issue the
license.
(1984 Code Sec. 116.22)
733.04 TERM AND RENEWAL OF LICENSE; LIMITATION ON ISSUANCE.
         Any license, as required in Section
733.01, granted as provided in this chapter, shall be effective for a period of
not more than forty-five days from the date of the first day of the sale, but
may be renewed for a period of not more than forty-five days; provided, that
proof satisfactory to the Director of Finance is first submitted to him showing
that the stock itemized in the original application has not been disposed of.
No license, as required in Section
733.01, shall be granted to any person who has previously held a license during
the period of one year next succeeding the expiration of the previous license
or a renewal license.
(1984 Code Sec. 116.23)
733.05 LICENSE FEE.
         Upon the grant by the Director of Finance of a license, as required by
Section
733.01, the Director shall receive from the applicant to whom the license is
granted, a license fee of ten dollars ($10.00).
(1984 Code Sec. 116.24)
733.06 INVESTIGATIONS.
         The Director of Finance or the Chief of Police shall make the
investigations and inquiries throughout the conduct of any sale for which a
license is required under Section
733.01, as he shall deem advisable to effectuate the provisions and purposes of
this chapter and shall administer oaths, if necessary, in connection with
taking testimony appertaining thereto.
(1984 Code Sec. 116.25)
733.07 EXCEPTIONS.
         This chapter shall not apply to sales conducted by sheriffs,
constables or other public or court officials or to any person acting under the
direction or authority of any court, State or federal, selling goods, wares or
merchandise in the course of official duty, or to sales by licensed
auctioneers.
(1984 Code Sec. 116.26)
733.99 PENALTY.
         Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a
misdemeanor of the fourth degree. Every addition of goods, wares or merchandise
to stock on applicant's premises and each sale of the goods, wares or
merchandise in the original inventory in the license application, shall
constitute a separate offense.
CHAPTER 737
Home Sales
737.01 Regulations; permit; signs; exemptions.
737.99 Penalty.
 
 
737.01 REGULATIONS; PERMIT; SIGNS; EXEMPTIONS.
         No person or corporation shall allow the public sale of personal
property except as provided herein.
         (a)    Scope. The provisions of this section shall apply to any public
sale of personal property within the City including garage sales, patio sales,
yard sales, porch sales, driveway sales or any similar sale. It shall not
include bona fide business transactions or other sales as specifically
authorized by law nor shall it apply to activities conducted by and on the
property of tax exempt corporations, churches, temples, schools, fraternities,
sororities, clubs, lodges or units of government. Organizations described in
the previous sentence may utilize the property of another organization named in
that sentence.
         (b)    Permit. Prior to the sale of personal property, any person or
corporation not exempted in subsections (a), (c) or (h) hereof shall receive a
permit from the Director of Administration or his duly authorized designee. The
price of the permit shall be established by the Board of Control. Such price
shall cover the cost of issuance and shall not be a tax.
        (c)    Permit Exemption. No permit shall be required for the first home
sale conducted at a location within six calendar months, provided that such
sale shall not exceed three consecutive days nor shall it be conducted other
than between the hours of 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.. A location shall be defined
as a lot of record. Further, such sale shall comply with subsections (f) and
(g) hereof.
         (d)    Duration.  The permit described in subsection (b) hereof shall
be valid for three days from the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. The dates
shall be designated on the permit. All items for sale, all display signs, and
other materials relating to the sale must be removed from the view of the
public not later than 8:30 p.m. on the last day of the sale.
         (e)    Frequency. No more than two permits shall be issued to any
person or address during one calendar year.
        (f)    Limitations. Sales under the provisions of this section shall be
limited to used items. No property purchased specifically for resale shall be
permitted. All merchandise offered for public sale must be intended solely for
domestic or household use and must be displayed on private property only.
         (g)    Signs. No sign advertising the sale shall be displayed at any
place except on the premises on which the sale is to be held. One side may be
displayed provided that its area shall not exceed four square feet, except that
the same sign may have two sides not exceeding four square feet each.
        (h)    Exemptions. This section shall not apply to the sale of property
publicized solely by classified newspaper advertising which describes or
identifies the specific property offered for sale and does not designate the
date, hours or location of the sale other than stating the name, address and
telephone number of the seller.
         (1984 Code Sec. 116.30; Ord. 4329. Passed 2-9-10.)
737.99 PENALTY.
         Whoever violates this chapter shall, upon conviction of a first
offense, be guilty of a minor misdemeanor. On a second offense within one year
after the first offense, such person is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth
degree; on each subsequent offense within one year after the first offense,
such person is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree.
(Ord. 4329. Passed 2-9-10.)
CHAPTER 743
Junk and Secondhand Dealers
743.01     Display of signs; record of purchases.
743.02     Dealing with minors; hours when prohibited.
743.99     Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
State licensing and required fencing - see Ohio R.C. 4737.05 et seq.
Junk vehicles - see TRAF.
303.09,
303.10
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.61
Secondhand dealers - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 4737
Record of transactions required - see Ohio R.C. 4737.01, 4737.04
Dealing with minors prohibited; hours regulated - see Ohio R.C. 4737.03
 
 
743.01 DISPLAY OF SIGNS; RECORD OF PURCHASES.
         Every keeper of a shop or store for the purchase, sale or barter of
old metals, secondhand furniture or secondhand articles of any kind shall put
up, in some suitable or conspicuous place on his shop or store, a sign having
his name and occupation legibly inscribed thereon and shall keep a book in
which shall be written at the time of every purchase of any old metals or
secondhand articles, a description of the articles purchased, the name, age and
residence of the person from whom, and the day and hour when the purchase was
made.
(1984 Code Sec. 112.01)
743.02 DEALING WITH MINORS; HOURS WHEN PROHIBITED.
         No person shall purchase or receive by sale, barter, exchange or
otherwise, an article mentioned in Ohio R.C. 4737.01 to 4737.03, inclusive, of
a minor or apprentice, knowing or having reason to believe him to be such, or
from any person between the hours of 9:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m.
(1984 Code Sec. 112.02)
743.99 PENALTY.
         Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of
misdemeanor of the first degree.

CHAPTER 755
Solicitors, Peddlers and Vendors
755.01     Definitions.
755.02     License required.
755.03     Cold canvass prohibited.
755.04     License application; requirements.

755.06     Appeal to Council of license denial.
755.07     Carrying or exhibiting license; identification badge.
755.08     Hours regulated.

755.10     License transfer; use.
755.11     Revocation of license.

CROSS REFERENCES
Power to inspect food products - see Ohio R.C. 715.46
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.61 et seq.
Home solicitation sales - see Ohio R.C. 1345.21 et seq.
Charitable solicitations - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 1716
Frozen desserts - see Ohio R.C. 3717.51 et seq.

521.08
 
 
755.01 DEFINITIONS.
         For the purpose of this chapter, the following words and phrases shall
have the following meanings ascribed to them respectively.
         (a)    "Canvasser" or "solicitor" means any person, whether a resident
of the City or not, traveling either by foot, wagon, automobile, motor truck or
any other type of conveyance, from place to place, from house to house or from
street to street, taking or attempting to take orders in person or by telephone
for the sale of goods, wares and merchandise or personal property of any nature
whatsoever, for future delivery, or for services to be furnished or performed
in the future; and any home remodeling, pest removal or preventive measures or
any service involving the entrance of the "canvasser" or "solicitor" or any
crew or workmen directly involved with the sale of a service upon private
property.
         (b)    "Peddler" means any person, whether a resident of the City or
not, who carries with him for the purpose of sale and immediate delivery from
house to house, goods, wares and merchandise.
        (c)    "Cold canvass" means the uninvited telephone contact of a person
by a canvasser or solicitor not having a permanent place of business within the
City or for and on behalf of a person, firm or corporation not having a
permanent place of business within the City.
         (d)    "Itinerant vendor" or "transient dealer" means any persons,
both principal and agent, who engage in or conduct in this City a temporary or
transient business of selling goods, wares and merchandise, with the intention
of continuing in the business for a period of not more than 120 days and who,
for the purpose of carrying on the business, hire, lease or occupy either in
whole or part a room, building or other structure for the exhibition and sale
of the goods, wares and merchandise.
         (e)     Exceptions to the definitions of "peddlers", "canvasser" or
"solicitor" are the following:
                 (1)    A person selling or making delivery of goods, wares or
merchandise previously sold by an establishment having a permanent place of
business within the City.
                 (2)    A minor under eighteen years of age.
                 (3)    A person making sales of the following items for daily
household consumption:
                      A.    Baked, goods;
                      B.    Fruits, vegetables, eggs and similar agricultural
products;
                      C.    Dairy products, except dealers of frozen desserts
from vehicles.
                 (4)    A person working for or on behalf of any recognized
educational, political, civic, religious, medical or charitable organization or
cause.
                 (5)    Persons taking orders for cosmetic products.
                 (6)     Insurance agents possessing a valid license to do
business in Ohio.
                    (1984 Code Sec. 113.01)
755.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
         No person, firm or corporation shall engage in the business or
activity of a peddler, solicitor, canvasser, itinerant vendor or transient
dealer within the City without first obtaining a license therefor, as provided
in this chapter.
(1984 Code Sec. 113.02)
755.03 COLD CANVASS PROHIBITED.
         No person, firm or corporation shall engage in a cold canvass within
the City.
(1984 Code Sec. 113.03)
755.04 LICENSE APPLICATION; REQUIREMENTS.
         (a)    Application for licenses for peddlers, solicitors, canvassers,
itinerant vendors and transient dealers shall be filed with the Director of
Finance on a form to be furnished by the Director which shall require, at
least, the following information:
                 (1)    Name of applicant;
                 (2)    Home address of applicant;
                 (3)    Name and address of the person by whom employed;
                 (4)    Length of service with the employer;
                 (5)    All places of residence and all employment during the
preceding year;
                 (6)    The nature and character of the goods to be sold or
service to be furnished by the applicant;
                 (7)   Names of other towns in which the applicant has recently
conducted a business for which license is herein required; and
                 (8)    A personal description and history of the applicant.
         (b)    The applicant shall furnish a recent photograph of himself not
more than one year old and approximately three square inches. Fingerprints of
the applicant shall be furnished and made in duplicate. The application shall
be made at least ten days before the license is required.
         (c)    If the Director determines, after an investigation, that the
applicant proposes to engage in a lawful commercial or professional enterprise
and does not, based upon past record, constitute a clear and present danger to
the residents of the City, he shall issue a license to the applicant.
(1984 Code Sec. 113.04)
755.05 LICENSE FEE; TERM.
         (a)   For any license to be issued under the provisions of this
chapter, each applicant shall consent to a background check and pay the
applicable fee established by Urbana Police Division policy for Webcheck
fingerprinting, with direct mailing of the results from BCI to the Director of
Finance. Once on file with the Director of Finance, applicants shall update
background checks every three years and may renew licenses annually.
   (b)   Each applicant shall pay fifteen dollars ($15.00) annually to cover
additional administrative expenses related to licensure. All licenses expire
December 31, of that calendar year in which they are acquired, regardless of
the date the license is issued unless renewed prior to December 31. For any
renewal license within the three year period, the annual fee must be paid
before December 31 or an updated background check is required.
(Ord. 4424-14. Passed 5-27-14.)
755.06 APPEAL TO COUNCIL OF LICENSE DENIAL.
         Any applicant who has applied for a license in accordance with this
chapter and to whom the Director of Finance has, after an investigation, denied
a license, may appeal to Council. Notice of the appeal shall be filed with the
Clerk of Council within five days after the denial by the Director. Council, on
appeal, may grant or reject the application for license unless the applicant’s
background check reveals a conviction for any crime of moral turpitude such as
theft or related offenses, or any crime of violence.
(Ord. 4424-14. Passed 5-27-14.)
755.07 CARRYING OR EXHIBITING LICENSE; IDENTIFICATION BADGE.
         The license issued under the provisions of this chapter shall be
exhibited in the place of business by an itinerant vendor or transient dealer,
and shall be carried by any peddler, solicitor or canvasser at all times when
peddling, soliciting or canvassing and shall be exhibited to any person being
solicited or any police officer on request. Further, an identification badge
shall be issued to all peddlers, solicitors or canvassers, which shall be worn
by them when peddling, soliciting or canvassing.
(1984 Code Sec. 113.07)
755.08 HOURS REGULATED.
         All peddling, soliciting or canvassing done under a license issued by
virtue of this chapter shall be conducted between the hours of 9:00 a.m. and 8:
00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time or 9:00 p.m. Eastern Daylight Savings Time, on
weekdays and Saturdays. No peddling, soliciting or canvassing shall be
conducted on Sunday, or upon any residence displaying a "No Solicitor" or "No
Peddler" sign.
755.09 LOUD NOISES AND SPEAKING DEVICES.
         No peddler, or any person in his behalf, shall shout, make any outcry,
blow a horn, ring a bell or use any sound device, including any loud-speaking
radio or sound amplifying system, upon any of the streets, alleys, parks or
other public places of the City or upon any private premises in the City, where
sound of sufficient volume is emitted or produced therefrom to be capable of
being plainly heard upon the streets, avenues, alleys, parks or other public
places for the purpose of attracting attention to any goods, wares or
merchandise which the peddler proposes to sell.
(1984 Code Sec. 113.09)
755.10 LICENSE TRANSFER; USE.
         No license shall be assigned or transferred. No licensee shall
authorize any person, firm or corporation other than the one named therein to
do business. No licensee shall conduct any other business than is listed in his
application to be transacted. A separate license shall be required for each
individual peddler, solicitor, canvasser, itinerant vendor or transient dealer,
whether or not employed by one person, firm or corporation.
(1984 Code Sec. 113.10)
755.11 REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
         Any license issued under the provisions of this chapter may be revoked
at any time, should the person to whom it is issued be guilty of any fraud,
misrepresentation or unlawful act in connection with his business; or otherwise
is found to be a person not fit to be engaged in the business; or violates any
of the provisions of this chapter.
(1984 Code Sec. 113.11)
755.99 PENALTY.
         Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor. Each day's violation shall constitute a separate offense.
CHAPTER 761
Shooting and Archery Ranges (Repealed)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Chapter
761 was repealed by Ordinance 4515-19, passed December 17, 2019.)
CHAPTER 767
Taxicabs
IN GENERAL

767.02     Cruising; solicitation of passengers.
767.03     Exceptions.
LICENSES

767.07     Issuance of taxicab license.
767.08     License separate and nontransferable for each vehicle.
767.09     Contents.
767.10     Fees.
767.11     Insurance.
767.12     Term generally; application for extension of term.
767.13     Extension of term by Director of Public Service and Safety.
767.14     Modification of provisions and substitution of equipment.
767.15     Revocation of taxicab license.
767.16     Driver's license.
767.17     Requirements of taxicab drivers.
767.18     Issuance of driver's license.
767.19     Renewal of driver's license.
767.20     Revocation or suspension of driver's license.
